```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
x = 0:9
m = sample(2:4,1)*sample(c(-1,1),1)
b = sample(40:60,1)
f = m*x+b

h = sample(1:8,1)
k = m*h+b

```

Question
========

Consider the linear function, $f$, shown in the table below:

```{r,echo=F,warning=FALSE}
library(kableExtra)
data <- data.frame(
  x,
  f
)
colnames(data) = c("x","f(x)")
kable(data, "html") %>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "bordered",full_width=F)
```
\

What is the value of function $f$ when the argument (the input) is `r h`? In other words, evaluate $f(`r h`)$.

$$f(`r h`)~=~?$$


Solution
========

Find the row in the table where the input $x=`r h`$ (where the left column has a `r h`). Find the corresponding output $f$ value in the right column.

$$f(`r h`)~=~`r k`$$
